alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued September 30 at 2:09PM PDT until October 01 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT SUNDAY ABOVE 8000 FEET... * CHANGES...Slightly higher snow total potential for Sunday. * WHAT...Snow, mainly above 8000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches between 8000 and 10000 feet, with totals 4 to 8 inches above 10000 feet. * WHERE...Mono County including areas around Sonora Pass, Tioga Pass, Mammoth Mountain, and the White Mountains. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT Sunday. Snowfall will be intermittent, with the heaviest snow rates occurring this evening and again Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions over mountain passes.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
